rComments: Great class and a great professor. She actually makes the effort to learn everyone's names. This class does come with a lot of work, quizzes, weekly papers, writing assignments, and an quarter long independent project.  Her tests are only material that she goes over during lecture and the book is only used for her quizzes.

One of the best professors I've had. Yes her class is demanding and it can be a little overwhelming, but its worth the effort. You'll get a lot of lab and field experience. Her exams are straight forward and as long as you keep up with her lectures then studying should be a breeze. The book helpful but very lengthy.

Anyone who thinks Ingrid is hard Should drop out of school. She is one of the best professors ever. If you are passionate about the subject and want more than a degree, then it should be a breeze cause all the info is fun to learn! Her tests are very reasonable and straight from lecture. No surprises. Teachers should model themselves after her.

Ingrid is a fantastic professor.  The class is demanding, but necessary if you plan on doing field work or research.  The field trips are great, and Ingrid is one the coolest professors at this school.

Parker is, very truly, a good prof. Her lecture notes are clear, and easy to copy. HOWEVER, the caveat to this class is she tells you her test is ~85% all lecture notes. this is completely false. Her lecture notes serve as a GUIDELINE to what you should read THOROUGHLY in the book. Do this and you will excel in the class.

Avoid taking this class with her if you can. She treats her students like middle schoolers and her tests/quizzes assess whether or not you went to class/did the reading, not whether you understand the information. She mostly tests on her specific examples or if you recognize a figure in the book.

Good but demanding professor. The course goes really fast and there is a lot of memorization involved. Weekly quizzes on large portions of reading, but if you keep up with everything and memorize her notes you should be fine.
Class was hard she's really loves the subject but test way too vague

Although professor is passionate about the subject, she wasn't really clear about exam topics. 8am attendance is mandatory via iclicker, no notes posted online, her exam was very specific. go to msi for help

Uses iClicker forcing you to go to class and actively listen yet she doesn't post lecture notes and is extremely vague with what she puts on the test. Avoid taking this class with her. But if you have to read  the book and you should be fine.

She is AMAZING. Although some of the concepts were difficult, she was always open to answering questions and was very enthusiastic about helping us out. Exams were super easy if you studied her 'study questions' and previous exams. Great class overall as a learning experience--and this is coming from someone with no interest in plants before.

Ingrid is great. She's enthusiastic and friendly. Although she lectures quickly and things might seem unclear, she is always available to answer questions. This class requires a lot of time, but it's worth it if you're interested in plants.

I loved Ingrid! She is very knowledgeable in plant ecology and really wants students to learn real world applications of ecology. The course is pretty challenging but worth it if you're interested in plants.

Powerpoints are very disorganized.She talks to the class as if they are 4th graders.Read the book,you'll be fine.Her exam is VERY TRICKY! Be careful when reading her questions and see what she's asking.Try to avoid taking this class with her,if you can't it's only 5 weeks.

Ingrid was an extremely knowledgeable and enthusiastic professor!  I love that she focused on real world ecology studies and allowed us to be creative in designing our own project focus.  One of the best classes I've ever taken!

Great Professor! =) She is VERY enthusiastic about plants. You can tell that she is very passionate about what she teaches, and is always finding different ways to make the class interesting. Her tests/quizzes are fair. If you study you WILL be able to do well. I definitely recommend studying at least 5 days in advanced. Her midterm is al
Great professor! Not too much work, but still worth it. I got a very good understanding from her class about plant biology.

Her lectures were super unorganized and made it difficult to take notes. Her tests are based mostly on her lectures though. She was nice, but not helpful at all. I felt like she was inhibiting me from actually learning about plant biology instead of inspiring me. I would not recommend her and I have liked all of my professors so far at UCSC.

She is an awful professor. She designs her powerpoints the night before class and it shows. She uses terrible drawing that she makes herself. She quizzes you on chapters that she has not gone over yet, so when you read you do not know what to focus on and then she asks questions about specific figures in the book instead of key concepts.

Do not take this class from her if you can avoid it. Her lectures were disorganized and she even admitted that she makes them the night before. She uses terrible drawings that she makes herself. She quizzes you on things that she has not gone over, but come from specific figures in the book, as apposed to important concepts. She was terrible.

Wonderful professor. Her class will leave you working hard and thinking about the applications of plant ecology and why it matters, especially the lab class. Completely worth my time. Only thing to watch out for if you're taking the lab is make sure you get yourself a good proofreader if your writing is shaky, you'll need them.

Very nice, and thoroughly enthusiastic about the subject. Great for plants majors and ecologists alike! Her midterms and finals weren't terrible, a bit on the hard side. Only qualms were that she used her own overheads as source material. Kinda difficult, but they were also well made.

Do NOT take the college 8 second quarter core if you are an environmental studies major - not fun at all. I spent the entire quarter relearning APES material and reteaching my idiot friends all the material after class. Ingrid is a decent teacher, shes incredibly nice and tries to be helpful, but assigns enough busywork to kill any college kid.

Ingrid is by far one of the best professors at UCSC. She is tough but intensely knowledgeable. You'll work until you think you'll collapse, but it is well worth ALL of the time and effort you put into it!!!!

Ingrid is the real deal- This is a TOUGH course, you'll work harder than you can imagine for 5 units (or 10 if you take the lab) but you'll feel like a real scientist when she's done with you. Although they're not prerequisites, I STRONGLY recommend BioStats & General Ecology as preparation for Plant Ecology.

okay i thought biology was about understanding how the concept works? not how scientists were able to come up with their stupid theories. the class was fun and all but her midterm was NOT GOOD AT ALL. it was WAAAAYY too biased since it's based on all her notes and sucks for you if u miss class coz u prolly missed  7% on the exam.

Prof parker makes the plant section of bio 20b very interesting. She really takes interest in students and answers  all questions as best as she can. Pay close attention in lecture, test in based on it and can be very tricky.

I didnt enjoy the plant hunting, but she is one of the better teachers on campus. Go to class, because test are based off lecture and the book is way too in depth 4 the month long section off the course.
No Comments
No Comments

Boy was this class an adventure! Be prepared to work your butt off, in and out of the field.  Definitely take this class if you want an awesome teacher to help you decide if you really want to work in the ecology field.

Really nice professor but goes way too fast on lecture powerpoint presentation. Teaches the plant half of the class. Grades include a midterm, weekly plant-of-the-week, assingnments, and hands-on lab experiment. Exam questions are a bit difficult and tricky.

Dr. Parker teaches the plant half of 20b. And her half was intense and very difficult. Her enthusiasm for teaching shined, which helped cuz learning bout plants sucks. Final=hard. Pay close attention to lectures, full of information and abstract concepts. DETAILS ARE KEY. U can survive w/o the book, but try to read it. Ended up liking the class.
super excited to be teaching and great at answering questions. be sure to go to lecture and take good notes cuz her tests are hard.
Ingrid is a fantastic teacher.  Her notes and examples are excellent and she wants her students to succeed.  Also, she looks great in a bathingsuit

Super enthusiastic about the subject - can even get an animal person to do a double take on plants. Lectures are VERY important, and read the book no matter what. Watch out for the exams. You'll definitely learn something!
She is cool, good lecture. Fun section work, I like her.

An adorable teacher that gets really excited about the subject.  Super helpful anytime you talk to her, in or outside of class or by email.  Some lectures she doesn't write enough detail and you need to study hard for tests, but her class is well worth it
